channel.title: python on Portfolio
channel.description: Recent content in python on Portfolio

item.title: Python is Cool
item.description: Yes yes these pythons are cool but let’s look at what else you can do with the Python programming language… Functions in Python def count_chars(sentence): counts = {} for c in sentence: if c in counts: counts[c]+=1 else: counts[c]=1 for c in counts: print(c, "appears", counts[c],"times") new_sentence = "I'm bored in the house and I'm in the house bored." count_chars(new_sentence) ## I appears 2 times ## ' appears 2 times ## m appears 2 times ## appears 10 times ## b appears 2 times ## o appears 4 times ## r appears 2 times ## e appears 6 times ## d appears 3 times ## i appears 2 times ## n appears 3 times ## t appears 2 times ## h appears 4 times ## u appears 2 times ## s appears 2 times ## a appears 1 times ## .

item.title: Rstudio and Python
item.description: Which one is the best language for data science? It seems like there is this great big divide between R users and Python users, with individuals on each side believing that their choice of language is the superior one. Even a quick Google search shows millions of results comparing the two. The reality is that R and Python can actually do a lot of the same things but just use a different code to get there.
